summary: This is an internal Department of Justice report listing child exploitation cases (coded 080 or 087) assigned to Lead AUSAs, with updates and case statuses. It includes references to the cases against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, as well as other defendants like David Williams. The document shows administrative tracking of case dismissals, indictments, and investigative steps.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as a defendant in case 19-CR-00490, arrested on 07/06/2019, with the case dismissed without prejudice on 08/29/2019. The document notes 'Nolle, suicide 8/29/19'.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Listed as a defendant in case 20-CR-00330, indicted on 06/29/2020. The case is flagged under 'Public Corruption Vic_Wit'.

persons.name: David Williams
persons.context: Listed as a defendant in case 20-CR-00049, arrested on 01/07/2020 and indicted on 01/17/2020 for charges including sex trafficking with a possible minor victim.

connections.description: Both are listed as defendants in separate but related federal child exploitation cases referenced in the same internal tracking report.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on federal charges.

events.title: Dismissal of Epstein Case and Death
events.description: The case against Jeffrey Epstein was dismissed without prejudice by the government. The document notes 'Nolle, suicide 8/29/19'.

events.title: Appeal Mandate Issued
events.description: The US Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit issued a mandate regarding Epstein's appeal (19-2221), noting a stipulation to dismiss the appeal.

events.title: Indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on federal charges.

events.title: Arrest of David Williams
events.description: David Williams was arrested on federal charges.

events.title: Indictment of David Williams
events.description: David Williams was indicted on charges including sex trafficking with a possible minor victim.

keyFacts: The document is an internal DOJ case tracking report for child exploitation/pornography cases (coded 080 or 087) assigned to Lead Assistant US Attorneys, dated February 23, 2021.
It records the dismissal without prejudice of the case against Jeffrey Epstein (19-CR-00490) on August 29, 2019, with the note 'Nolle, suicide 8/29/19'.
It records the indictment of Ghislaine Maxwell (20-CR-00330) on June 29, 2020, flagged under 'Public Corruption Vic_Wit'.
It records the case against David Williams (20-CR-00049) for sex trafficking with a possible minor victim, indicted on January 17, 2020.
The document instructs AUSAs to close cases or fruitless investigations promptly and return updates to offices in 'St. Andrew's' or 'White Plains'.
